title: Office Hours
text:
When: By appointment
Where: Carmen‚Äôs office (Bren Hall 4024) or Zoom
I‚Äôm here to help! Office hours are by appointment‚Äîjust send me a message via email or Slack, and we‚Äôll find a time that works for you or your team. Supporting each student and team with their capstone project is a top priority, so don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out. Looking forward to working with you!
Contact: e-mail (c_galazgarcia@ucsb.edu) or Slack




When: Mondays 9am-12pm, Tuesdays 2pm-5pm.
Where: Sandy‚Äôs office (Bren Hall 3017) or Zoom
Our class TA, Sandy Sum, is here to help!
Use this calendar to schedule a time that works for you.

Before your appointment, please fill out this form to share your question or problem.
Each team can book up to 45 minutes per week using the link above.
Appointments are available in 15-minute slots throughout the quarter.
Appointments outside of these times may be requested.
Drop by for quick questions‚Äîjust double-check that Sandy isn‚Äôt already in a scheduled appointment.

Contact: e-mail (sandysum@ucsb.edu) or Slack

title: Overview
text:
Welcome to the course materials for EDS 411A - MEDS Capstone! This course is part of the UCSB Masters in Environmental Data Science at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Mananagement.
In this website you will find the materials covered during lectures for the Winter 2024 term.



The goal of EDS 411A is to facilitate student learning, work, and progress on their MEDS Capstone project through lessons, activities, supervised and unsupervised project work, and peer review and feedback. Additionally, EDS 411A provides opportunities for professional and career development (e.g.¬†presentation skills, writing and editing, client relations, team science, panel discussions, and conflict resolution).



Click here to view syllabus.



Carmen Galaz Garc√≠a
Pronouns: she/her/hers
E-mail: c_galazgarcia@ucsb.edu
Office hour: by appointmnet, Zoom or NCEAS classroom
Best way to contact me: e-mail, Slack



The following is our ideal calendar, the course content may be subject to change as the course progresses.

title: Overview
text: The following is our ideal calendar, the course content may be subject to change as the course progresses.

title: Week 1
text:
üìï Class slides
üìó TA Office Hours Logistics - Sandy Sum
üìò Client Relations Presentation - Miya Scheble



1:00 - 2:00 : Overview of EDS 411, Capstone Project, and DIP
2:00 - 2:30: Client relations workshop - Miya Scheble, Bren School
2:30 - 2:35: BREAK
2:35 - 3:00: Communication roles activity
3:00 - 3:10: BREAK
3:10 - 3:50: Capstone project summary
3:50 - 4:00: Checklist for next class









Goals for first client meeting (to be held before next class):
‚òëÔ∏è Clarify what the objectives are (if you have any questions - know what they are before the meeting)
‚òëÔ∏è Address any issue with accessing data (determine beforehand what these might be)
‚òëÔ∏è Find out who the audience for your product will be and if there will be people who can test it
Before meeting the client meeting, develop an agenda, including:

who will be the meeting facilitator/chair and who will take notes
agenda (with times)
list of clarifying questions you want to ask the client
any questions about the data - make sure you know how to access it
PRO TIP: use the agenda template provided during the Fall quarter.

After meeting: reflect with your team on how it went and what could be improved.




Prepare 4 slides covering:

Slide 1: A cover slide

Slide 2: An ultra summarized slide covering what your project will do
Slide 3: A brief overview of the datasets you‚Äôll use
Slide 4: One graph showing exploratory visualization of your data

Pick a person or two who are ready to do a 3 minute presentation next class Add slides to Week 2 - Flash talks.
Focus on:

Avoiding big blocks of text.
Seamless transitions between sections, clear, and precise speech.
Practice and time it!
Listen for every qualifier you use. ‚ÄúKind of‚Äù ‚Äúsort of‚Äù ‚ÄúI guess.‚Äù Avoid these!

Flash talks are the first steps in practicing for the faculty reviews.




Read the following resources:
‚òëÔ∏è MEDS Capstone Project Guidelines.
‚òëÔ∏è Sample DIPs*
‚òëÔ∏è Ten simple rules to cultivate belonging in collaborative data science research teams
Come prepared with questions about the guidelines and the sample DIPs. The ‚ÄúTen simple rules‚Ä¶‚Äù paper will give you a good background for your team management plan (we‚Äôll work on it next week).
*We have reworked the DIP this year to streamline it. So, the sample DIPs from previous years do not completely match the new DIP format. However they will still give you a good idea of the information that will go into it.




Submit by 5pm on Friday 1/17: Finalize your summary paragraph for Bren website, add to Capstone Summaries.  Your advisor must review your summary before submitting it.

title: EDS 411: MEDS Capstone Courses
text:
Welcome to the course materials for MEDS Capstone Courses EDS 411A and EDS 411B! This course sequence is part of the UCSB Masters in Environmental Data Science at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Mananagement.
In this website you will find the materials covered during lectures for the 2024 Winter and Spring terms. This site will be under construction throughout the course.


The goal of MEDS Capstone Courses EDS 411A and EDS 411B is to facilitate student learning, work, and progress on their MEDS Capstone project through lessons, activities, supervised and unsupervised project work, and peer review and feedback. Additionally, these courses provides opportunities for professional and career development (e.g.¬†presentation skills, writing and editing, client relations, team science, panel discussions, and conflict resolution).




411A Syllabus




Carmen Galaz Garc√≠a (she/her/hers)
E-mail: c_galazgarcia@ucsb.edu
Best way to contact me: e-mail, Slack



Sandy Sum (she/her/hers)
E-mail: sandysum@ucsb.edu
Best way to contact me: e-mail / Slack
